page.title: 12Brownsover Hall
page.content: At Brownsover Hall there are thirty bedrooms. It costs Â£41 for a double bed with a private bathroom. A single bed with private bathroon costs Â£35. It was built in 1850 and rebuilt in 1890, by Gilbert Scott. It has got 7 acres of land with many deer. {Royalty have stopped there. A workman has seen a ghost. It is now owned by the Chevron company. There is a legend that when the Boughton Leigh family owned the hall, a spirit of a one handed Horseman who drove a coach pulled by six horses haunted the building. This spirit is now contained in a bottle and is in the possesion of the Boughton Leigh family. Many famous people stay in the hotel and in 1980 they hosted the worlds billiard championships.
